sentence.text: Patient 4 had downslanting palpebral fissures and absent lower eyelashes, micrognathia and cleft palate.
The ears were small, low set and posteriorly rotated.
The left arm showed radioulnar synostosis, an absent first ray and clinodactyly of the index finger (Fig. 2g).
On the right hand, the thumb was hypoplastic and proximally placed (Fig. 2h).
He had a club foot on the right and was born with a patent ductus arteriosus.
He deceased at the age of 6 weeks due to meningitis.
